Comments_List:
1. Knowledge about several techniques that can be used to solve a diverse range of artificial intelligence problems, along with their strengths, weaknesses and future developments
2. Implementation of some important techniques and experiments with their capacities and limitations.

I learned a lot about the history of artificial intelligence and how the techniques developed in this area have been applied and have influenced society. I also learned about neural networks and those are REALLY COOL.
I learned a lot in this course, including but not limited to: searching, planning, motion planning, logic, autonomous vehicles, communication, and perception.
AI
Learn AI technique
Basic knowledge of AI
Introductions to AI and some algorithm implementations.
A wide range of different AI topics; algorithms and applications
Different concepts of Artificial Intelligence
AI algorithms, concepts and background knowledge.

Strengths: A wide variety of topics are covered with abundant examples and discussions.
Weaknesses: Since there is not yet a course specialized for advanced algorithms in AI, I personally would prefer more detailed discussion of some algorithms (e.g. in the form of reading materials)

The course was very well organized, very interesting, and very engaging. Prof. Scaz is an amazing instructor. Unfortunately the course was extremely understaffed considering the number of students enrolled.
material is outdated--  would have been great if taught 10 years ago
I though the homeworks were helpful for learning the material, but did not always require a strong understanding of the material. The lectures were very well done and were very well planned out.
Good assignments, materials are old.
Assignment can be more clear
Strength: well-organized, the homework is highly related to the lectures.

Strengths: Large coverage of useful topics and algorithms 
Weakness: Some chapters are not very helpful. They are too brief and not many insights.
The class is very organized and you can learn from each assignment

The course was very well prepared, involving both coding requirement and concept exams. The instructor designs the course careful, and combine the course with latest development and news, which is very good for a better understanding of AI. In addition, I like the idea to separate class in three classes per week, so that each class is not too long and full of interesting concept. I am satisfied with the current design, not much to improve. But I notice that there are not enough TA for this class.

Strengths:
Covers a broad range of topics in AI.

Weakness:
There are too much theoretical topics and not enough practical implementation.
hard for non-cs majored student
Yes. This course is a very good introductory course for students interested in general AI topics.
Yes! The material was extremely cool and relevant.
not really

For sure! You learn so much without doing a whole bunch of busy/boring work. The lectures are structured in such a way that you learn a lot in a short amount of time about subject that you previously knew very little about.
Yes.
Yes, if you are interested in AI
Yes, very good introduction of AI, workload reasonable
Yes. For students who are new to AI, this is a good start. This course covers many useful algorithms and applications of AI.
Yes.
Yes, I highly recommend this course. It is very good for students who are interested in AI. The workload is proper, and the lectures are very well prepared.

If you wish to learn some background knowledge, basic concepts and ideas in AI, take this course. If you wish to gain more practical experience on implementation, maybe the assignments are too easy for you.
